data.title: Belzer pulls out of Fringe : News 2003 : Chortle : The UK Comedy Guide
data.meta_description: Belzer pulls out of Fringe - Clash with movie dates
data.text:
Acclaimed American stand-up Richard Belzer has pulled out of the Edinburgh fringe, citing movie commitments.

The star of Homicide has been scheduled to play three dates at the Crowne Plaza Hotel to coincide with the screening of the movie Bitter Jester, which he produced.

His show was much-anticipated by stand-up devotees - reflected in the fact that, at Â£17.50 a ticket, his would have been the most expensive one-man show on the Fringe.

However, he will now be filming - and unable to make the Fringe gig.

Filling his slots at the venue will be a showcase of American stand-up hosted by Bitter Jester star Maija DiGiorgio and featuring Tina Kim and Lewis Schaffer.

Published: 18 Jun 2003
